_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Lincoln Terminal Company - Petersburg Terminal is a butane railcar storage and transloading facility (specifically, railcar to truck tanker). This Risk Management Plan (RMP) covers the Butane Railcar Storage and Transloading process (Program Level 3) including storage of up to 31 butane railcars and approximately 2 transloading units.



The Lincoln Terminal Company - Petersburg Terminal complies with the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency's (EPA) accident prevention rules (40 CFR Part 68 Subpart D) and the Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) Process Safety Management (PSM) Standard (29 CFR Part 1910.119). This butane railcar storage and transloading system is designed, constructed, and maintained in accordance with NFPA #58 and the manufacturer's instructions. Railcars meet the U.S. Department of Transportation Federal Railroad Administration design requirements for pressurized tank cars.



Petersburg Terminal maintains an Emergency Action Plan and has been designated a "non-responding" facility". As such, in the event of an emergency involving the Butane Railcar Storage and Transloading process, it is the policy of the Facility to evacuate personnel and contact the Petersburg Department of Fire, Rescue, and Emergency Services to request their assistance. Facility personnel have received emergency response training and all contractors and visitors are briefed on appropriate emergency actions prior to being permitted onsite.



Petersburg Terminal has coordinated their Emergency Action Plan with the Petersburg Department of Fire, Rescue, and Emergency Services, the Office of the Fire Marshall, and the City of Petersburg LEPC. In addition, representatives from the Petersburg Department of Fire, Rescue, and Emergency Services have attended onsite orientation/training.



Petersburg Terminal does not currently have any full-time or part-time Lincoln personnel on-site and is instead staffed entirely by contract personnel. There are an estimated 6 con

tract employees on-site or in the vicinity of the site during operational hours.



This is an RMP for a new facility and therefore has never had an accident involving butane which has resulted in deaths, injuries, property/environmental damage, evacuation or sheltering in-place.



In an effort to improve and promote system safety, Lincoln Terminal Company looks for, and seeks employee input, on process safety improvements. Additionally, Lincoln Terminal Company intends to coordinate response with the local agencies annually at minimum.
